parser

Class MyParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • parser.MyParser

  • public class MyParser
extends java.lang.Object
    The parser recognizes whether an input string of tokens is a valid Mini-Pascal program. During this process a syntax tree is formed for later traversal. To use a parser, create an instance pointing at a file, and then call the top-level function, program(). If the functions returns true, the file is a valid Mini_Pascal Program that is ready to be compiled.
    Author:
    Allen Burgett

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyParser

        public MyParser(java.lang.String text,
                boolean isFilename)
        Initializes a Parser. The input can be read as a stream of text or from a file.
        Parameters:
        text, - the string to be parsed.
        isFilename, - if the string is a file name, pass true.

    • Method Detail

      • program

        public boolean program()
        Checks to see if the given text is a Mini-Pascal program. During this check a syntax tree is built and can be used to generate assembly code.
        Returns:
        true if the given text is valid Mini_Pascal code.
